dt: {bc}the quality or state of existing in or assuming different forms: such as
{bc}existence of a species in several forms independent of the variations of sex
{bc}existence of a gene in several allelic forms
{bc}a variation in a specific DNA sequence
{bc}existence of a molecule (such as an enzyme) in several forms in a single species
{bc}the property of crystallizing in two or more forms with distinct structure

shortdef: the quality or state of existing in or assuming different forms: such as
existence of a species in several forms independent of the variations of sex
existence of a gene in several allelic forms; also : a variation in a specific DNA sequence

dt: {bc}variation in the length of a DNA fragment produced by a specific restriction enzyme acting on DNA from different individuals that usually results from a gene mutation and that may be used as a genetic marker

shortdef: variation in the length of a DNA fragment produced by a specific restriction enzyme acting on DNA from different individuals that usually results from a gene mutation and that may be used as a genetic marker
